cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles SE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the Yucatan today, then turning north-north-east across the Gulf of Mexico toward the northern Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana to Mississippi coastline (near the mouth of the Mississippi River)

weather_observation.under_watch: Tropical Storm Watch (and Storm Surge Watch)
weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch Intracoastal City, LA to Navarre, FL (includes Mobile Bay); Tropical Storm Watch Mississippi/Alabama border eastward to Okaloosa/Walton County Line, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: No warnings in effect for Mobile; Hurricane Warning confined to Yucatan Peninsula at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana through the Florida Panhandle including Mobile Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely (34–50 kt) with a small chance of gusts near hurricane force as the center passes west of Mobile Bay.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of inundation possible in Mobile Bay and along the Alabama coast; 4–6 ft possible just west toward Dauphin Island if the track shifts east.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with isolated totals to 6 inches, producing localized flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes in outer rain bands Wednesday and Wednesday night.
